plugin.name: google-calendar
plugin.description: Manage events, meetings, and schedules in Google Calendar
plugin.context: Use for fetching calendar events, creating meetings, scheduling appointments, setting reminders, managing attendees, and organizing time-based activities for agents

list_events.description: List calendar events within a specified time range
list_events.usage_context: When user wants to fetch upcoming events, check availability, see scheduled meetings, or retrieve calendar data for a time period

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier (use 'primary' for user's primary calendar or specific calendar email)

time_min.description: Start of time range (ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z')

time_max.description: End of time range (ISO 8601 format, optional - defaults to unbounded)

max_results.description: Maximum number of events to return (max 2500)

single_events.description: Whether to expand recurring events into individual instances

order_by.description: Order results by start time or last updated time

max_results_limit.message: Cannot retrieve more than 2,500 events at once. Please reduce max_results.

large_fetch.message: Fetch {max_results} events? This may take a moment to process.

common_errors.auth_failed: Your Google Calendar connection has expired. Please go to Settings → Connected Apps to reconnect Google Calendar.
common_errors.calendar_not_found: The calendar was not found. Please check the calendar ID and ensure you have access.
common_errors.invalid_time_format: The time format is invalid. Use ISO 8601 format like '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'.
common_errors.permission_denied: You don't have permission to access this calendar. Please request access from the owner.
common_errors.api_rate_limit: Too many requests in a short time. Please wait a moment and try again.
common_errors.insufficient_permissions: Google Calendar permissions are insufficient. Please reconnect with full calendar access.

create_event.description: Create a new calendar event or meeting
create_event.usage_context: When user wants to schedule a meeting, create an appointment, add calendar events, or set up recurring events with attendees and reminders

calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier to create event in

conference_solution.description: Generate Google Meet link for the event

max_attendees.message: Cannot add more than 100 attendees to a single event.

many_attendees.message: Create event with {attendee_count} attendees? Email notifications will be sent.

common_errors.auth_failed: Your Google Calendar connection has expired. Please reconnect in Settings → Connected Apps.
common_errors.calendar_not_found: The calendar was not found. Please check the calendar ID.
common_errors.invalid_time_format: The time format is invalid. Use ISO 8601 format like '2024-01-15T10:00:00Z'.
common_errors.invalid_attendees: One or more attendee email addresses are invalid.
common_errors.permission_denied: You don't have permission to create events on this calendar.
common_errors.api_rate_limit: Too many event creation requests. Please wait a moment and try again.
common_errors.insufficient_permissions: Google Calendar write permissions are insufficient. Please reconnect with full access.

update_event.usage_context: When user wants to modify event details, reschedule meetings, change attendees, or update event information

event_id.description: ID of the event to update

attendees.description: Updated list of attendee email addresses

send_notifications.description: Send email notifications about the update to attendees

send_update_notifications.message: Send update notifications to all attendees?

common_errors.event_not_found: The event was not found. Please check the event ID.
common_errors.calendar_not_found: The calendar was not found. Please check the calendar ID.
common_errors.invalid_time_format: The time format is invalid. Use ISO 8601 format.
common_errors.permission_denied: You don't have permission to edit this event.
common_errors.api_rate_limit: Too many update requests. Please wait a moment and try again.
common_errors.insufficient_permissions: Google Calendar write permissions are insufficient. Please reconnect with full access.

delete_event.usage_context: When user wants to cancel meetings, remove events, or delete calendar entries

event_id.description: ID of the event to delete

delete_confirmation.message: Delete this calendar event? This action cannot be undone.

send_cancellation.message: Send cancellation notifications to all attendees?

get_event_details.usage_context: When user wants to view event details, check meeting information, or retrieve specific event data
